question:
What types of facilities are typically found within a Computer Science department to support research and education?

(Note: The given context is incomplete, but the question has been formulated based on the provided keyphrase.)
contexts:
['Also in

Computer Science

Computer Science facilities']
ground_truth: Typically, a Computer Science department would have various facilities to support research and education including computer labs with up-to-date hardware and software, lecture halls for teaching large groups of students, libraries stocked with relevant literature, as well as specialized equipment like servers, supercomputers, or lab spaces equipped for specific types of computing research such as machine learning, data analysis, or network security.

question: What percentage of NTU's research impact was assessed as world-leading or internationally excellent in the latest Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021, and how did this compare to the previous REF assessment?
contexts:
["Cyber Security Research Group (CSRG)
        The cyber security research group (CSRG) is a dynamic team of seasoned professionals dedicated to researching and implementing effective solutions to safeguard against cyber threats.

Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021

In the latest Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021, 86% of NTU's research impact was assessed to be either world-leading or internationally excellent. The overall quality of each Unit of Assessment NTU submitted to REF in 2021 also saw an improvement from the previous REF in 2014.

Find out more about REF 2021

Find out more about our research

Our facilities

With over £8 million invested, our computer science students will study in facilities designed to very high specifications with a variety of electronic and communication laboratories."]
ground_truth: In the latest Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021, 86% of NTU's research impact was assessed as either world-leading or internationally excellent. This represents an improvement from the previous REF assessment in 2014.

Computer Science

question: What areas of research does the Computational Intelligence and Applications Research Group focus on, and how do they contribute to advancements in computational intelligence applications?
contexts:
['Centre for Computer Science and Informatics (CIRC)
        Harnessing enabling technologies ranging from machine learning, AI, and advanced display technologies, to intelligent sensors and robotics to drive advances for individuals and society.

Research groups

Interactive Systems Research Group (ISRG)
        The Interactive Systems Research Group focuses on the development of new technologies for the cognitive and physical rehabilitation of users within the real world.

Computational Intelligence and Applications Research Group (CIA)
        This research group brings together academics researching in the areas of computational intelligence applications.

Cognitive Computing and Brain Informatics Research Group (CCBI) 
        This research group is centred around brain research, mainly brain computer interfacing (BCI) including EEG hyper scanning, and body sensor networking (BCI).']
ground_truth: The Computational Intelligence and Applications Research Group focuses on researching computational intelligence applications. They contribute to advancements in this field by bringing together academics who are dedicated to exploring various areas within computational intelligence, which can lead to the development of innovative technologies and solutions that enhance computing capabilities.

question: What are some of the state-of-the-art facilities available at NTU's Clifton Campus for students studying Computer Science?
contexts:
["- BSc (Hons)

About Computer Science

From artificial intelligence to game technology, our courses span the whole spectrum of computer science.

You’ll study in state-of-the-art facilities at our Clifton Campus, which includes a robot arena, games consoles, networking and security, and human-interactive technology labs. It’s a self-contained campus with all the mod cons and equipment you might need.

You can count on the support of industry veterans from across the sector – from Fujitsu Systems to the US Department of Homeland Security. You can apply your learning to work placements, live industry briefs and research projects, as you gain real-world experience and enhance your career prospects in computing.

Learn more about Computer Science at NTU

Discover the inspiring story behind Hannah's decision to pursue Computer Science at NTU. Look through other videos for an insightful tour of our facilities and get a glimpse into the enriching academic journey that awaits you."]
ground_truth: Some of the state-of-the-art facilities available at NTU's Clifton Campus for students studying Computer Science include a robot arena, games consoles, networking and security equipment, and human-interactive technology labs. The campus is self-contained with all necessary modern amenities.

question: What is the purpose of offering a virtual tour at NTU's Computer Science Department?
contexts:
['Department of Computer Science
        Welcome to the Computer Science Department at NTU. The department combines internationally significant research with an outstanding record for teaching excellence. Our state-of-the-art facilities and career-focused approach to course design provide the right conditions for students to succeed in their chosen fields.

Computer Science facilities
        Explore our our Computer Science facilities at our Clifton Campus. You can take a look at the outstanding lab facilities in our ISTeC building.

Take a virtual tour
        The NTU virtual tour is a great way to get to know our University from the comfort of your own home.

Supporting your success
        What makes life and learning at NTU so special? Discover just a few of the benefits and free services designed to enhance your student experience.

Search for a specific course

Order a prospectus

Book an open day

Learn about life in Nottingham

Chat to students or staff

Also in']
ground_truth: The purpose of offering a virtual tour at NTU's Computer Science Department is likely to allow prospective students and others interested in the department to explore its facilities, programs, and environment from the comfort of their own home. This can help them get a better understanding of what studying there would be like and assist them in making informed decisions about whether it aligns with their academic and career goals.

question: What role do industry support and work placements play in enhancing career prospects for students studying Computer Science at NTU?
contexts:
["- BSc (Hons)

About Computer Science

From artificial intelligence to game technology, our courses span the whole spectrum of computer science.

You’ll study in state-of-the-art facilities at our Clifton Campus, which includes a robot arena, games consoles, networking and security, and human-interactive technology labs. It’s a self-contained campus with all the mod cons and equipment you might need.

You can count on the support of industry veterans from across the sector – from Fujitsu Systems to the US Department of Homeland Security. You can apply your learning to work placements, live industry briefs and research projects, as you gain real-world experience and enhance your career prospects in computing.

Learn more about Computer Science at NTU

Discover the inspiring story behind Hannah's decision to pursue Computer Science at NTU. Look through other videos for an insightful tour of our facilities and get a glimpse into the enriching academic journey that awaits you."]
ground_truth: Industry support and work placements play a significant role in enhancing career prospects for students studying Computer Science at NTU. They provide real-world experience, allowing students to apply their learning directly within the industry context. This exposure helps them gain practical skills, understand current industry trends, network with professionals, and potentially secure job opportunities post-graduation.

question:
What is the significance of undergraduate courses in ach Written as a letter, address it to "Dear Student," and ensure that your question reflects the importance of these programs at NTU's Department of Computer Science.


Dear Student,


I hope this message finds you well and excited about embarking on an educational journey with us at the Department of Computer Science at National University of Technology (NTU). As a prospective student considering our undergraduate courses, I would like to highlight their significance in shaping your future career.


Question: "How do NTU's accredited undergraduate computer science programs prepare you for success and industry relevance in the field of technology?
contexts:
['Home

Study

Academic Schools

Science and Technology

Department of Computer Science

Department of Computer Science

Welcome to the Department of Computer Science at NTU. The department combines internationally significant research with an outstanding record for teaching excellence. Our state-of-the-art facilities and career-focused approach to course design provide the right conditions for students to succeed in their chosen fields.

Our undergraduate and postgraduate courses are designed to be industrially relevant with the right balance of theory and practice. The British Computing Society (BCS) have accredited all of our undergraduate degrees to Chartered IT Professional (CITP) status, and towards Chartered Engineer (CEng) status with the Engineering Council. We are a thriving department combining expertise with modern facilities and equipment to create an outstanding environment for learning and development.']
ground_truth: NTU's accredited undergraduate computer science programs are designed to be industrially relevant, providing a balanced mix of theory and practical experience. The British Computing Society (BCS) has accredited all our degrees for Chartered IT Professional (CITP) status and towards Chartered Engineer (CEng) status with the Engineering Council. This recognition ensures that our programs meet high industry standards, equipping students with the necessary skills to excel in their careers and remain competitive in the rapidly evolving field of technology.

Meet Nottingham Trent University’s Department of Computer Science.', 'language': 'en', 'filename': 'https://www.ntu.ac.uk/study-and-courses/academic-schools/science-and-technology/Computer-Science'}]

question: What are some of the key organizations that provide research funding for the department's activities?
contexts:
['The strength and relevance of our teaching and research are underpinned by a healthy synergy with a network of external businesses and organisations. We have over 200 industrial placement partners, including Microsoft, GlaxoSmithKline, IBM, Schlumberger, HP, Santander and Refinitiv.

Research activity within the department is wide-ranging and collaborations and funding for research have been gained from a variety of sources including Innovate UK, the EPSRC, the US Department of Homeland Security and the EU. Our research is internationally recognised, particularly in the areas of serious games, computational intelligence and security.

Meet the team']
ground_truth: Some of the key organizations providing research funding for the department's activities include Innovate UK, the EPSRC (Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council), the US Department of Homeland Security, and the EU (European Union).

question: How do NTU CS grads typically find jobs, and what role does industry ties play in this?
contexts:
["Careers in Computer Science

The industry-focused nature of our courses ensures you stand out from the crowd when it comes to job applications and pursuing your future career. Our graduates are widely respected amongst employers and are perceived as having a competitive edge due to the hands-on approach of our teaching.

Our recent graduates have secured roles at companies including:

Next Retail Ltd

Boots UK

Cisco Systems

Schlumberger

Experian

BT

Rockstar Games

Worldwide Clinical Trials UK Ltd

American Express

UK Government

They have gone into a wide variety of job roles including:

Business Analyst

Programmer

Project Software Implementation Officer

Web Developer

Games Tester

Graduate Game Development and Programmer

Software Engineer

Cyber Security Analyst

Product Consultant

Explore Computer Science

Find out about the facilities you'll have access to on your course and the benefits and support you'll receive as an NTU student."]
ground_truth: NTU CS graduates typically find jobs through a combination of their strong academic foundation, practical experience gained during their courses, and the industry-focused nature of our teaching. The industry ties are significant as they provide students with direct exposure to real-world applications and opportunities for networking, which can be instrumental in securing employment after graduation.

question:
Which REF year saw notable contributions from NTU's Cyber Security Group, aligning with CS Dept.'s focus on top-tier facilities and teaching? (Hint: Ref 2021)

(Note: The hint "Ref 2021" is provided to guide the reader towards REF 2021 without explicitly stating it in the rewritten question.)
contexts:
["Cyber Security Research Group (CSRG)
        The cyber security research group (CSRG) is a dynamic team of seasoned professionals dedicated to researching and implementing effective solutions to safeguard against cyber threats.

Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021

In the latest Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021, 86% of NTU's research impact was assessed to be either world-leading or internationally excellent. The overall quality of each Unit of Assessment NTU submitted to REF in 2021 also saw an improvement from the previous REF in 2014.

Find out more about REF 2021

Find out more about our research

Our facilities

With over £8 million invested, our computer science students will study in facilities designed to very high specifications with a variety of electronic and communication laboratories."]
ground_truth: The notable contributions from NTU's Cyber Security Group aligning with CS Dept.'s focus on top-tier facilities and teaching were recognized in the Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2021, where 86% of research impact was assessed to be either world-leading or internationally excellent.
